My father is about 80 he said that when he was a child crabs was about arms length. And there were fish in abundance which got decimated after the making of this Bund.<br />\n<br />\nI live near the banks of this great lagoon Vembanad</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_87BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_86T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_86TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_86TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_86TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_86TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_86TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_86TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_86TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_86TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_86B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8999152062033656086\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_86M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/08/the-vadakayil-report-ecological.html?showComment=1535750050253#c8999152062033656086\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">September 1, 2018 at 2:44 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_86MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nONE OF MY ELECTRICAL OFFICERS TOLD ME THIS<br />\n<br />\nHE REMEMBERS VERY CLEARLY-<br />\n<br />\nWHEN HE WAS FIVE YEARS OLD-- HIS HOME WAS BY THE BANKS OF VEMBANAD WATERWAY.<br />\n<br />\nHIS MOTHER USED TO SHOUT FROM THE KITCHEN WHEN HE WAS PLAYING-- SON GO AND FETCH SOME WATER TO MAKE TEA..<br />\n<br />\nHE USED TO TAKE A SMALL METAL BUCKET , RUN, DIP INTO THE WATER AND GIVE IT TO HIS MOTHER<br />\n<br />\nHE SAID-THE TEA TASTED DIVINE<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">55 YEARS LATER HE WENT TO THE SAME SPOT --THE WATER HAD A BAD STENCH.. THE WHOLE AREA WAS RIDDEN WITH WATER HACYINTHS ..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nHE DIPPED HIS LEFT LEG TO THE KNEE IN THE WATER-- WITHIN AN HOUR RASHES BROKE AND HE WAS SCRATCHING SO BADLY THAT HE HAD TO SEE THE DOCTOR..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHOM DO WE THANK?<br /><br />THE FATHER OF THE DESH DROHI GREEN REVOLUTION MS SWAMINATHAN..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nNOW HIS DAUGHTER DR SOUMYA SWAMINATHAN , THE DG OF WHO ( WORLD HEALTH ORG ) IS TRYING TO SAVE INDIA..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kochi/kerala-to-get-antibody-from-australia-to-fight-nipah-virus/articleshow/64321705.cms</span><br />\n<br />\nYOU SEE --OUT OF COMPASSION SHE HAS BEEN TRYING TO SAVE PEOPLE OF KERALA WITH UN-TESTED VACCINES.. YES-- HER FATHER TOO HAD HAJAAAAR COMPASSION FOR BHARATMATA.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_87b+seedP0CD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/o-P1E886ZJE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/o-P1E886ZJE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/zOoE42UMDIU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/zOoE42UMDIU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HbnZZrs8SNc/W4m8-06LqoI/AAAAAAABd94/EL6ztDYtoRYC9jgPV5w0xdRRXPXf1dnsQCLcBGAs/s1600/Proposed-schemes-of-freDsh-water-storage-strategy-in-Ashtamudi-Lake.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"375\" data-original-width=\"573\" height=\"418\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HbnZZrs8SNc/W4m8-06LqoI/AAAAAAABd94/EL6ztDYtoRYC9jgPV5w0xdRRXPXf1dnsQCLcBGAs/s640/Proposed-schemes-of-freDsh-water-storage-strategy-in-Ashtamudi-Lake.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FeI6RieG7KU/W4m-u-r19QI/AAAAAAABd-M/eTSHvIreQEwG8FDtLbfAChf21dDu9AfswCLcBGAs/s1600/im232ages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"188\" data-original-width=\"268\" height=\"448\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FeI6RieG7KU/W4m-u-r19QI/AAAAAAABd-M/eTSHvIreQEwG8FDtLbfAChf21dDu9AfswCLcBGAs/s640/im232ages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ykktfc4__sk/W4m_EBSZBvI/AAAAAAABd-U/L_w1mvuDJP0-DJKxtTOEGPRYlaK_UriPACLcBGAs/s1600/fig1FF-2k15-1-15.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"871\" data-original-width=\"621\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ykktfc4__sk/W4m_EBSZBvI/AAAAAAABd-U/L_w1mvuDJP0-DJKxtTOEGPRYlaK_UriPACLcBGAs/s1600/fig1FF-2k15-1-15.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IfbT5XxSlPI/W4m_3teNlLI/AAAAAAABd-g/WjCPW_RF0e8O7xhMzgSrh_2c5Xh_EenPQCLcBGAs/s1600/menon-SSSSSand-george-uei-day-2-kochi-jan18-7-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"479\" data-original-width=\"638\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IfbT5XxSlPI/W4m_3teNlLI/AAAAAAABd-g/WjCPW_RF0e8O7xhMzgSrh_2c5Xh_EenPQCLcBGAs/s640/menon-SSSSSand-george-uei-day-2-kochi-jan18-7-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kuttanad region has the\nlowest altitude in India, and is one of the few places in the world where\nfarming is carried around 4 to 10 ft below sea level.. Farmers of Kuttinad are\nfamous for Biosaline Farming. FAO has declared the Kuttanad Farming System as a\nGlobally Important Agricultural Heritage Systems (GIAHS). Four of Kerala's\nmajor rivers, the Pamba, Meenachil, Achankovil and Manimala flow into the\nregion. It is well known for its boat race in the Punnamada Backwaters, known in\nMalayalam as Vallamkalli. The major occupation in Kuttanadu is farming, with\nrice the most important agricultural product. This activity gives the area its\nmoniker of \"The Rice Bowl of Kerala\". Large farming areas near\nVembanad Lake were reclaimed from the lake. The history of paddy cultivation in\nKuttanad can be traced back for millenniums\u2014the first on the planet to do\nagriculture and grow grain. In earlier times, reclamation was carried out\nmainly from the shallow part of the Vembanad Lake or from the periphery of the\nPamba River. These reclamations constituted small areas of paddy fields called\npadsekharams. Bailing out of water from the fields were done manually using\nwater wheels called chakram. Gradually the manual method used for bailing out\nof water gave way to steam engines. . Venadu kayal and Madathil Kayal were &nbsp;the first \"Kayal Nilams\" to be\nreclaimed from the Vembanad Lake.. Then came Cherukara Kayal and Pallithanam\nMoovayiram Kayal land reclamations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN ANCIENT DAYS THERE\nWERE ENOUGH WATER BASINS TO PREVENT FLOODING DURING HEAVY RAINS . THEN THE LAKE\nWAS FILLED WITH SOIL TO RECLAIM LAND FOR RICE CULTIVATION AND BUILDING HOUSES\n..WHOEVER CONVERTED TO CHRISTIANITY WERE GIVEN FREE LANDS..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In 1912, the British Madras Government\napproved a proposal &nbsp;for further\nreclamations. Under this scheme kayal land was notified for reclamation in\nblocks each named with a letter of the English alphabet. &nbsp;The first was E-Block Kayal measuring a total\narea 2,400 acres.. In the first period Blocks A to G measuring 6300 Acres were\nreclaimed. C Block, D Block(Attumukham Aarayiram (Attumuttu Kayal), Thekke\nAarayiram and Vadakke Aarayiram) and E Block (Erupathinalayiram Kayal) F Block\n(Judge's Aarayiram Kayal) and G Block (Kochu Kayal) are the major Kayal nilams..Blocks\nH to N covering an area of 3600 acres.. , R Block Kayal covered 1,400 acres. The\nlast tract of the reclamations were&nbsp; Q, S\nand T blocks. As farming in the area increased, farmers felt themselves\nconstrained by the two cycles a year for rice cultivation. The reason for which\nis the limited availability of potable water in Kuttanadu. During the monsoon\nseasons, the water from the mountains flow through the rivers to the sea,\nbringing potable water to Kuttanadu. But during summer, due to the low level of\nthe region seawater enters Kuttanadu, significantly increasing the salinity of\nthe water and making it unpotable.&nbsp; Thottappilli\nSpillway&nbsp;&nbsp; was designed as a permanent\nsolution to the flood situation in Kuttanad. This programme was envisaged in\nsuch a way that flood waters from Pamba, Manimalayar and Achankovil were\ndiverted to the sea before it reached Vembanad lake. The construction of the\nSpillway ended by 1959. In 1968, the Government of India proposed that a bund\n(Dam) be made across the river so that seawater would not be allowed to come\ninside Kuttanad during summer, allowing farmers to cultivate an extra crop per\nyear. With this, it was possible to close the regulator of shutters during\nDecember\u2013June when the saline water enters, and then open it during monsoon.\nOnce the Thanneermukkam bund and spillway became operational two crops were\npossible in Kuttanad.that are chambavu and karutha charu. </span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even though the bund\nhas improved the quality of life of the farmers, the bund has caused severe\nenvironmental problems. The backwaters which were abundant with fish and part\nof the staple food of the people of the region require a small amount of salt\nwater for its breeding. The bund has caused deterioration of fish varieties in\nthe region and the fishermen opposed to the bund as of 2005. The bund has also\ndisrupted the harmony of the sea with the backwaters and has caused problems\nnot foreseen before the bund like the omniprescence of the water weeds. Earlier\nthe salt water tends to cleanse the backwaters but this does not happen any\nmore leading to the pollution of the backwaters and the entire land near by.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> The\nThanneermukkom Bund (Thannermukkom Salt Water Barrier) was constructed as a\npart of the Kuttanad Development Scheme to prevent tidal action and intrusion\nof salt water into the Kuttanad low-lands across Vembanad Lake between\nThannermukkom on south and Vechur on north. Thanneermukkom Bund was constructed\nin 1974 and is functional since 1976. It is the largest mud regulator in India.\nThis barrier essentially divides the lake into two parts - one with brackish\nwater perennially and the other half with fresh water fed by the rivers\ndraining into the lake. The barrier has divided the Vembanad lake into two\nparts converting the upstream part in to a fresh water coastal reservoir. It is\npresently the only one coastal reservoir in India. It was built in the narrow\nportion of the Vembanad Lake to prevent the ingress of&nbsp; salinity&nbsp;\ninto&nbsp; the&nbsp; polders&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; Kuttanad&nbsp; during summer and&nbsp; also to retain the&nbsp; fresh water from the rivers flowing into the\nlake. It is about 1250m long..&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> This\nbarrier has helped the farmers in Kuttanad - where farming occurs below sea\nlevel. It has however also created ecological problems, primarily, the rampant\npropagation of the Water Hyacinth in fresh water. The backwaters which were\nabundant with fish and part of the staple food of the people of the region\nrequire a small amount of salt water for their breeding. The salt water barrier\nhas caused deterioration of the catch of fish in the region.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">. The shutters are\nopened during monsoon to pass the flood waters and are closed later for six\nmonths approximately.. Vembanad (Vembanad Kayal or Vembanad Kol) is the longest\nlake in India, and the largest lake in the state of Kerala. The Nehru Trophy\nBoat Race is conducted in a portion of the lake. High levels of pollution have\nbeen noticed at certain hotspots of the Vembanad backwaters. Government of\nIndia has identified the Vembanad wetland under National Wetlands Conservation\nProgramme. The Vembanad wetland system covers an area of over 2033.02 km\u00b2\nthereby making it the largest wetland system in India. Of this, an area of\n398.12 km\u00b2 is located below the MSL and a total of 763.23 km\u00b2 area is located\nbelow 1 m MSL. The lake is bordered by Alappuzha, Kottayam, and Ernakulam\ndistricts. It is situated at the sea level, and is separated from the Arabian\nSea by a narrow barrier island. Canals link the lake to other coastal lakes in\nthe north and south. The lake surrounds the islands of Pathiramanal, Perumbalam\nand Pallippuram. The Vembanad Lake is approximately 14 kilometres wide at its\nwidest point. The lake is a part of Vembanad-Kol wetland system which extends\nfrom Alappuzha in the south to Azheekkode in the north, making it by far,\nIndia's longest lake at just over 96.5 km in length. The lake is fed by 10\nrivers flowing into it including the six major rivers of central Kerala namely\nthe Achenkovil, Manimala, Meenachil, Muvattupuzha, Pamba and Periyar. The total\narea drained by the lake is 15,770 km\u00b2,which accounts for 40% of the area of\nKerala..The Vembanad Wetland system was included in the list of wetlands of\ninternational importance, as defined by the Ramsar Convention for the\nconservation and sustainable utilization of wetlands in 2002. It is the largest\nof the three Ramsar Sites in the state of Kerala. </span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vembanad lake has been\nheavily reclaimed over the course of the past century with the water spread\narea reducing drastically.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> In the same\nperiod almost 63.62 km of erstwhile water spread were reclaimed primarily for\nformation of polders and to enlarge the extent of the Wellington island of\nCochin port.</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> The lake faces a major ecological crisis and has reduced to 41% of\nits original area, as a result of land reclamation. Most of the housing on\nreclaimed land is illegal , allowed by Communist and Christian political\nparties for party cadre.. Today they are all flooded. </span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Thanneermukkom\nbarrier is located at one of the narrower parts of the Vembanad Lake. Only\ntwo-thirds of the original number of gates are opened in July to release flood\nflow. These gates remain closed until mid-November. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">The main drawback of the\nstructure has been the loss of opportunity for fish and prawns to migrate\nupstream for spawning.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">BONGS DON\u2019T GET HILSA\nFISH ANYMORE AND THEY HAVE TO BEG&nbsp; FROM\nBANGLADESH DUE TO THE FARAKKA BARRAGE, WHICH DOES NOT HAVE A FISH LADDER..\nHILSA FISH SWIMS UP THE GANGES FOR HUNDREDS OF MILES TO SPAWN IN FRESH SWEET\nWATER.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Marine&nbsp; prawns, belonging&nbsp; to&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; family&nbsp; Penaeidae,&nbsp;\nare&nbsp; exploited both in the marine\nand estuarine waters. </span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">They spawn in&nbsp; the\nsea&nbsp; and the&nbsp; larvae migrate&nbsp; to the&nbsp;\nestuary to feed in the nutrient-rich environment. &nbsp;With&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; onset&nbsp; of southwest&nbsp;\nmonsoon,&nbsp; salinity&nbsp; declines&nbsp;\nrapidly &nbsp;to almost fresh&nbsp; water throughout the&nbsp; estuary, resulting in reduction in the number\nof estuarine fish species. </span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">From September onwards, the brackish water habitat\ngradually extends to the backwater and marine fish, tolerant to a wide salinity\nrange, appear in the lower reaches&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; the&nbsp; estuary.&nbsp;\nDuring&nbsp; the&nbsp; pre-monsoon period, the physico-chemical\nconditions at the mouth and lower reaches of the estuary are very similar to\nthose&nbsp; of&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; adjacent&nbsp; sea.&nbsp;\nCoastal&nbsp; marine&nbsp; fish, tolerant&nbsp; to&nbsp;\nwide&nbsp; salinity fluctuations,&nbsp; migrate&nbsp;\nover long distances into the estuary.. Prawn&nbsp; filtration&nbsp;\nin&nbsp; the adjoining rice fields of\nbackwaters is a unique feature of the inland fisheries of Kerala. The earliest\nform of brackish&nbsp; water&nbsp; aquaculture&nbsp;\nis&nbsp; represented&nbsp; by&nbsp; the\nconventional prawn farming being undertaken in the low-lying rice fields close\nto the estuaries and lower reaches of rivers.&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Thanneermukkom barrier increases the weed growth in the upstream,\nseverely restricting the natural flushing of pollutants.</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">The Thanneermukkom\nbund has&nbsp; created ecological problems,\nprimarily, the rampant propagation of the Water Hyacinth in fresh water.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIA HAS THINKS TANKS\u2014\nALL MANNED BY THINKERS WITH SHIT FOR BRAINS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over 1.7 million people\nlive on the banks of the Vembanad lake and are directly or indirectly dependent\non it for their livelihoods.. The port of Kochi (Cochin) is located at the\nlake's outlet to the Arabian Sea. The town of Alappuzha is called the\n\"Venice of the East\" for its large network of canals that meander\nthrough the town - is sandwiched between the lake and the sea. Thottappally\nSpillway is Kuttanad's drain-way out to the Arabian Sea. The Thottappally\nSpillway splits the Thottappally lake with the fresh water part to the east and\nsaline Thottappally river mouth to the west merging with the Arabian Sea.\n</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thottappally spillway is constructed to spill excess water coming over the\nUpper Kuttanad and Lower Kuttanad regions through Manimala River, Achancovil\nRiver and Pamba River. It is designed such that it could spill off 20,000 cubic\nmeters of water per second, but after its construction it was found that it is\nable to spill 550 cubic meters of water per second. Reasons for this reduced\nflow rate are, due to rise of sea water level suring spring water tides, strong\nadverse sea breezes during rainy seasons resulting in a rise in sea level\nrelative to the water level of Kuttanad, formation of sand bars on the western\narea of the spillway and the width of the leading canal is too narrow to carry\nthis much water to the spillway</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">.. The Vembanad Wetland system has formed an\nintricate network of estuaries, lagoons and canals which spans over 196 km in\nthe north-south and 29 km in the east-west directions. Almost all villages in these\nareas can be accessed via water transport.. The Kottappuram-Kollam segment of\nthe west coast canal system has a major chunk passing through the Vembanad Lake\nand spans a total of 209 km. It has been declared as a National Waterway.\nVembanad Kol Wetland was included in the list of wetlands of international\nimportance, as defined by the Ramsar Convention for the conservation and\nsustainable utilization of wetlands. The Ramsar Convention on Wetlands of\nInternational Importance especially as Waterfowl Habitat is an international\ntreaty for the conservation and sustainable use of wetlands. It is also known\nas the Convention on Wetlands. It is named after the city of Ramsar in Iran,\nwhere the Convention was signed in 1971. Wetlands are vital for human survival.\nThey are among the world\u2019s most productive environments; cradles of biological\ndiversity that provide the water and productivity upon which countless species\nof plants and animals depend for survival. The wetland system functions as a\nreceptacle to the&nbsp; monsoon flood&nbsp; flows. The total area of the wetland system\nis 1521.5 sq.km, approximately 4.0% of the state\u2019s geographical area. Wetlands\nare indispensable for the countless benefits or \u201cecosystem services\u201d that they\nprovide humanity, ranging from freshwater supply, food and building materials,\nand biodiversity, to flood control, groundwater recharge, and climate change\nmitigation. The most important factor producing wetlands is flooding. The\nduration of flooding or prolonged soil saturation by groundwater determines\nwhether the resulting wetland has aquatic, marsh or swamp vegetation. Wetland\nsystems that are made of permeable sediments like limestone or occur in areas\nwith highly variable and fluctuating water tables especially have a role in\ngroundwater replenishment or water recharge. Sediments that are porous allow\nwater to filter down through the soil and overlying rock into aquifers which\nare the source of 95% of the world's drinking water. Kuttanad acts as a\nreceptacle to receive the flood waters of the fast flowing river systems Periyar,\nMuvattupuzha, Meenachil, Pampa and Achenkovil, all originating from the Kerala\npart of Western Ghat mountain ranges which receives two monsoonal rains, south\nwest and north east. These rivers and their distributaries criss-cross Kuttanad\nwetlands and Vembanad lake before meeting Arabian Sea. The organic matter\ntransported from the high ranges makes Kuttanad a unique ecosystem in the world\ndue to its location near equator, equitable temperature regime, high rainfall\nand high solar radiation throughout the year Most of the areas in Kuttanad are\nwater logged almost throughout the year and subjected to flood during the\nmonsoon period. During the monsoon floods, the whole area becomes engulfed under\na vast sheet of water as the above rivers branch into many water courses which are\nconnected to one another. The flood waters move towards the Vembanad Lake to be\ndrained to the Arabian Sea through Cochin Estuary.. Kuttanad wetland system is\nundergoing transformation very fast due to unsustainable agriculture --major\nproblems being lack of profit, lack of labourers, increasing cost of labour and\ntheir migration for other better jobs, reduction in yield, increased weed\ninfestation and diseases etc. As per reports, </span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">35% of the area has been\nabandoned and these abandoned rice fields are causing major ecological changes\ninto sudds and floating islands and swamps overgrown with weeds.. Weed growth\nis creating serious problems of infectious diseases like recently spreading dengue\nfever, chikungunya etc.&nbsp; Kuttanad is\nheavily polluted due to excess application of artificial fertilizers, toxic pesticides\nand other harmful chemicals in the plantations of upstream catchments of river\nsystems.. Water is made in to a stagnant cesspool during the summer months,\nwith low &nbsp;low water level and less water\nflow. The situation got further deteriorated after the commissioning of\nThanneermukkom salt water barrier in 1975, which prevented the tidal activity\nduring summer months; otherwise the water can flow and get diluted with the\ntidal seawater. The unscientific construction of several roads, by obstructing\nthe canals and water ways, also contributed to the situation.. </span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once completed,\nthe Thanneermukkom bund, with a span of 1,410 metres, will have 90 shutters,\nincluding 31 each on the western and eastern sides<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN A WAY THE CURRENT\nKERALA FLOODS ARE A BLESSING IN DISGUISE FOR THINKERS ( WHO DON\u2019T HAVE SHIT FOR\nRAINS ) &nbsp;TO CHALK OUT REMEDIES.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LfAtKNX5iB0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/LfAtKNX5iB0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">T</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">his situation paved\nway for a series of problems like proliferation of unwanted noxious exotic\nweeds, poisonous snakes, less fish and agricultural production and number of\ninfectious diseases seriously affecting the health and livelihood of the inhabitants\nof the area. </span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The problems can be listed\nas follows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Nutrient\naccumulation and pesticide pollution due to excessive use of fertilizers and pesticides\nfor growing high yielding varieties of rice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Explosive growth of\nnoxious aquatic weeds Salvinia , Eichhornia, Pistia and a large number of other\ninvasive plants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Drastic reduction of\nfish production and increased rate of fish diseases and fish killings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Reduction in\nplankton, benthic fauna and native shell, fish and prawn yields.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Increased occurrence\nof water-borne diseases such as filariasis, schistomiasis, cholera, typhoid,\njaundice, gastroenteritis and dysentery and recently the leptospirosis .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Reduction of wetland\ndiversity due to the invasion of exotic weeds. A few dominant weeds are\noccupying most of the water surface.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Reduced flow rate in\nrivers due to interlocking of weeds and impoundment of large volume of water by\nthe construction of dams in their catchments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">8. Blocking of canals\nand lakes due to accumulation of weeds impaired the inland water transport.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">9. Pollution of\nVembanad Lake, rivers, canals and even the dug wells of Kuttanad. Depletion of\nquality of water in the rivers, lakes, canals and wells of Kuttanad is much severe\nin summer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">10. Illegal sand mining\nfrom the rivers affecting the flow of water to the lake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">11. Increased tourism\nactivity in the lake, particularly, water sports and boating lead to water pollution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">12. Accumulation of\nliquid and solid waste into the lake due to higher population density \u2013 in\nfact, highest amongst the Indian States \u2013 as well as from the human dwellings\nin the lake catchment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">13. Blocking of the\nfree flow of Vembanad Lake by the Thannermukkom Barrage for the prevention of\nsalinity intrusion</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kuttanad is home to\nmore than 21,000 waterfowls - the third largest such population in India. It is\nalso an ideal habitat for shrimps. Major livelihood activities of the people\nliving on the shores of the lake include agriculture, fishing, tourism, inland\nnavigation, coir retting, lime shell collection.</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> The sewage effluents and the\nheavy load of organic material released from the neighboring areas &nbsp;is let into the water and are responsible for\nthe decrease in dissolved oxygen content in the water in the water body.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> Vembanad\nWetland is hosting many of migratory birds in the season. In addition to this\nthe fragile ecosystem carries more than 100 birds as native. In comes in the\nway o Central Asian flyway. Tourism in this area is affecting the ecosystem and\nhence the life of 17 million people depending it. Again, Vembanad-Kol wetland\nsystem is fed by&nbsp; 10 rivers. All&nbsp; these rivers originate&nbsp; from the&nbsp;\nWestern Ghats,&nbsp; flow westwards\nthrough&nbsp; the&nbsp; wetland&nbsp;\nsystem&nbsp; and&nbsp; join&nbsp;\nin Arabian Sea. The wetland is typically divided&nbsp; into&nbsp;\ntwo&nbsp; distinct&nbsp; segments,&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; freshwater dominant southern\nzone and the&nbsp; saltwater dominant\nnorthern&nbsp; zone.&nbsp; The&nbsp;\nestuarine&nbsp; zone&nbsp; and&nbsp;\norganically rich&nbsp; sedimentary&nbsp; substratum&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; the&nbsp; inshore&nbsp;\nregion makes it a highly preferred and desirable habitat for shrimps\nbreeding.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Vembanad-Kol system is a\ncomplex aquatic system&nbsp; of&nbsp; coastal&nbsp;\nbackwaters,&nbsp; lagoons,&nbsp; marshes, mangroves and reclaimed lands,\ninlaid with intricate networks&nbsp; of&nbsp; natural&nbsp;\nand&nbsp; man-made&nbsp; channels.&nbsp;\nIt includes&nbsp; a&nbsp; chain&nbsp;\nof lagoons&nbsp; from&nbsp; Kuttanad&nbsp;\non the south to the Kol lands of Thrissur on the north. These\nwetlands&nbsp; are&nbsp; important&nbsp;\nfrom&nbsp; the&nbsp; point&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; view of their flora and fauna\nas well as their water chemistry.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThe&nbsp; seasonal&nbsp; rainfall&nbsp;\nfollowed&nbsp; by&nbsp; excessive flooding leaves extensive portions\nof these wetlands inundated for various periods of the year. When the\nfloodwater&nbsp; gradually&nbsp; recedes,&nbsp;\nnutrient-rich&nbsp; alluvial soils&nbsp; are&nbsp;\ndeposited,&nbsp; rendering&nbsp; them&nbsp;\nhighly&nbsp; fertile agricultural\nlands; this is the major reason why these wetlands&nbsp; have&nbsp;\nbeen&nbsp; subjected&nbsp; to&nbsp;\nlarge-scale reclamations.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\nExtensive&nbsp; areas&nbsp; of&nbsp; the&nbsp; lagoon&nbsp;\nhave been&nbsp; subjected&nbsp; to&nbsp;\nlarge-scale&nbsp; draining,&nbsp; filling&nbsp;\nand other&nbsp; developmental&nbsp; activities,&nbsp;\nmost&nbsp; of&nbsp; them government-sponsored,&nbsp; with&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; main&nbsp; objective&nbsp;\nof stepping&nbsp; up&nbsp; food&nbsp;\nproduction.. Later&nbsp;\nactivities&nbsp; have concentrated on\nflood mitigation. Hence, the present status of&nbsp;\nthese land-water systems is the result of&nbsp; a series&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; massive&nbsp; human&nbsp;\ninterventions&nbsp; and&nbsp; their consequences.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;The\nKerala backwaters are a chain of brackish lagoons and lakes lying parallel to\nthe Arabian Sea coast (known as the Malabar Coast) of Kerala state .. The\nnetwork includes five large lakes linked by canals, both man made and natural,\nfed by 38 rivers, and extending virtually half the length of Kerala state. The\nbackwaters were formed by the action of waves and shore currents creating low\nbarrier islands across the mouths of the many rivers flowing down from the\nWestern Ghats range. The Kerala Backwaters are a network of interconnected\ncanals, rivers, lakes and inlets, a labyrinthine system formed by more than 900\nkm of waterways..&nbsp; Ten rivers directly\ndrain into the Vembanad-Kol wetland&nbsp;\nsystem namely,&nbsp; Keecheri&nbsp; (basin area:&nbsp;\n400 km\u00b2,&nbsp; length 51&nbsp; km),&nbsp;\nPuzhakkal&nbsp; (250 km\u00b2, 29&nbsp; km), Karuvannur (1050 km\u00b2, 48&nbsp; km), Chalakkudy (1700 km\u00b2,&nbsp; 130&nbsp;\nkm),&nbsp; Periyar&nbsp; (5400&nbsp;\nkm\u00b2,&nbsp; 244&nbsp; km), Muvattupuzha (1550 km\u00b2, 121 km),\nMeenachil (1250 km\u00b2, 78&nbsp; km),\nManimala&nbsp; (850 km\u00b2,&nbsp; 90 km),&nbsp;\nPamba (2250 km\u00b2, 176 km), and Achenkovil (1500 km\u00b2, 128 km).&nbsp; The&nbsp;\nbasins&nbsp; together&nbsp; cover&nbsp;\nan&nbsp; area&nbsp; of&nbsp;\nabout 16200&nbsp; km\u00b2, out&nbsp; of which&nbsp;\n22% lies&nbsp; in the&nbsp; lowland, 23% in the&nbsp; midland, and the remaining 55% in the\nhighland.&nbsp; Vembanad covers an&nbsp; area of 2195 km2 and the Kol lands an area of\n521 sq.km. Rest of the area is covered with&nbsp;\nwaters of&nbsp; the estuaries,&nbsp; river systems and&nbsp; channels. Vembanad is the largest of the\nlakes, covering an area of 2033 km\u00b2. The lake has a large network of canals\nthat meander through the region of Kuttanad.</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> The cultivated wetlands are at or\nbelow mean sea&nbsp; level.&nbsp; These&nbsp;\nare&nbsp; divided&nbsp; into&nbsp;\npadasekharams (polders),&nbsp;\nwhich&nbsp; are&nbsp; enclosed&nbsp;\nby&nbsp; bunds (embankments)&nbsp; to&nbsp;\nseparate&nbsp; them&nbsp; from&nbsp;\nthe surrounding water bodies and to protect them from floods..In&nbsp; the&nbsp;\nKuttanad&nbsp; region,&nbsp; construction&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; em-bankments&nbsp; (bunds)&nbsp;\nin&nbsp; the&nbsp; shallow&nbsp;\nparts&nbsp; of&nbsp; the backwaters&nbsp; started&nbsp;\nat&nbsp; least&nbsp; a&nbsp;\ncentury&nbsp; ago.&nbsp; The purpose was to create large tracts of\nland&nbsp; in which the non-monsoon season\nrice crop&nbsp; (punja) could be grown&nbsp; between&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; end&nbsp; of&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; flood&nbsp; season (November)&nbsp; and&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; time&nbsp; in&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; dry&nbsp; season&nbsp;\nwhen water becomes too saline for agriculture. In course of time,\nthese&nbsp; padasekharams or&nbsp; group of&nbsp;\nfields have grown even to areas where water is 2.5m deep, and\npeople&nbsp; ( party cadre ) started&nbsp; to&nbsp;\nsettle&nbsp; on&nbsp; the&nbsp;\nembankments</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">..The&nbsp; Thottappally\nspillway,&nbsp; completed in&nbsp; 1955, was&nbsp;\nbuilt&nbsp; in&nbsp; the&nbsp;\nsouthernmost&nbsp; part of&nbsp; Kuttanad&nbsp;\nto divert&nbsp; a&nbsp; part&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; the&nbsp; combined&nbsp;\nflood&nbsp; -&nbsp; waters&nbsp;\nof&nbsp; Achencoil, Pamba and Manimala\nalong an easier and more direct outlet to the sea, flood waters of which\nwould&nbsp; otherwise&nbsp; find their&nbsp;\nexit&nbsp; through the&nbsp; Kochi mouth,&nbsp;\nafter&nbsp; traversing&nbsp; about&nbsp;\n75km.&nbsp; The&nbsp; objective was&nbsp;\nto&nbsp; limit&nbsp; \"flood&nbsp;\nbelow&nbsp; the&nbsp; embankment&nbsp;\nwhich would then naturally enable cropping during the wet season in&nbsp; the polders..</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, the capacity of the\nscheme turned out to&nbsp; be insufficient,\npartly because the&nbsp; channel&nbsp; leading&nbsp;\nto&nbsp; the&nbsp; spillway&nbsp;\nwas&nbsp; not constructed&nbsp; as&nbsp;\nper&nbsp; originally&nbsp; planned&nbsp;\nwidth. Consequently,&nbsp; the&nbsp; flood&nbsp;\ncarrying&nbsp; capacity&nbsp; of&nbsp; the\nspillway&nbsp; is&nbsp; far&nbsp;\nbelow&nbsp; the&nbsp; actual&nbsp;\nfloods.&nbsp; Moreover, every year, a\nsand bar is formed at the mouth of the spillway which has to be removed at the\nonset of the monsoon to release the floodwaters..The usually flooded areas of\nthe Thrissur Kol also used&nbsp; to&nbsp; suffer&nbsp;\nfrom&nbsp; salinity&nbsp; intrusion&nbsp;\nthrough&nbsp; the openings&nbsp; at&nbsp;\nChetwai&nbsp; and Kottappuram.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; Enamakkal barrage was&nbsp; constructed around&nbsp; five decade&nbsp;\nago to prevent salinity intrusion into the Kol lands from the Chetwai\nmouth. The regulator at Enamakkal and the minor one at Kottenkottuvalavu in the\nlower reach of the&nbsp; Karuvannaur&nbsp; river act&nbsp;\nboth&nbsp; as spillway&nbsp; for the flood waters from the wetland and as\na regulator for preventing salt&nbsp; water\nentry into&nbsp; the Kol&nbsp; lands. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">The observed capacity is far less..The&nbsp; major&nbsp;\ncause&nbsp; for&nbsp; pollution&nbsp;\nin&nbsp; the&nbsp; wetland, especially&nbsp; in&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp; Kuttanad&nbsp; area,&nbsp;\nis&nbsp; the&nbsp; overuse&nbsp;\nof agro-chemicals; the barrage does not permit flushing of these&nbsp; pollutants.</span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/iV0Ysvfr1Ic/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/iV0Ysvfr1Ic?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/---elnM8r6cs/W4nRoBb4fAI/AAAAAAABd-s/OsV8sVXEX2Q3HFkj_7X-uugncLJZJWxngCLcBGAs/s1600/iee4mages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"169\" data-original-width=\"299\" height=\"361\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/---elnM8r6cs/W4nRoBb4fAI/AAAAAAABd-s/OsV8sVXEX2Q3HFkj_7X-uugncLJZJWxngCLcBGAs/s640/iee4mages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/vJVUISt7cE0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/vJVUISt7cE0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mqK6ZZ3kKOk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/mqK6ZZ3kKOk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gadgil report had\npointed out that many reservoirs in the Western Ghats states, especially those\nin the steep valleys, were silting up prematurely due to massive encroachment\nand deforestation of catchment areas. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">\u201cIdukki dam is a\nclassic case wherein the entire catchment was encroached along the dam\nconstruction,\u201d the report said. </span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>MY LEFT BALL !!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS IS NOT THE WAY THE\nCOOKIE CRUMBLED MR MADHAV GADGIL. IT REQUIRES A REAL IDIOT TO WRITE SUCH A\nREPORT ..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">NOT ONE SINGLE DAM IN\nINDIA HAS BEEN FITTED WITH DESILTING FACILITIES..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">FOR EXAMPLE MULLAPERIAR\nDM IS SILTED BY MORE THAN 60%.. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHEN WATER HOLDING\nCAPACITY IS REDUCED, INSTEAD OF DE-SILTING MANUALLY, THE TAMIL NADU GOVT RUNS\nTO THE \u201cCOLLEGIUM LAWYER TURNED JUDGE \u201c DEMANDING THAT THE RESERVOIR WTER LEVEL\nBE INCREASED.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHEN THIS HAPPENS THE\nRESERVOIR WATER SURFACE INCREASES AND THEIR INDUNDATE LANDS WHICH WERE ALWAYS\nOUTSIDE WATER.. INCREASED WATER SURFACE AREA CAUSES MORE EVAPORATION LOSES ..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">SILTING&nbsp; IS MAINLY DUE TO DUE TO MASSIVE LANDSLIDES\nCAUSED BY INDUCED SEISMICITY AND OF COURSE USUAL MUD WHICH FLOWS DOWN A\nRIVER..&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THE&nbsp; MUD COMPONENT IN THE RESERVOIR SINKS TO THE\nBOTTOM IN A STAGNANT SYSTEM.. WHEN DAM SHUTTERS ARE OPENED ONLY CLEAR WATER ON\nTOP FLOWS.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I GUESS IT IS NOW\nBETTER THAT I PEN DOWN IN BRIEF THE GIST OF GADGIL AND KASTURIRANGAN REPORTS.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">HOW DID ENEMIES OF\nINDIA CREATE NAXALS AND CONVERT TRIBAL INDIANS INTO CHRISTIANITY?<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Gadgil report was\ncriticized as being too environment-friendly and Kasturirangan report was\nlabelled as being anti-environmental..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">After Kerala floods Madhav\nGadgil, came on TV with an aura of martyrdom \u2014 with that classic I TOLD YOU SO look. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">He publicly argued that\nhad his report\u2019s suggestions been implemented by the concerned state\ngovernments, the scale of the disaster in Kerala would not have been as huge as\nit is. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>MY LEFT BALL !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GlMEb_FUz3I/W4pvv0rTvII/AAAAAAABd-4/wGO9grZBc7cz9HPsOuz-RDj0H2jC9QRIACLcBGAs/s1600/dSownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"179\" data-original-width=\"282\" height=\"404\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GlMEb_FUz3I/W4pvv0rTvII/AAAAAAABd-4/wGO9grZBc7cz9HPsOuz-RDj0H2jC9QRIACLcBGAs/s640/dSownload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gadgil Committee\ndivided the Western Ghats into three ecologically sensitive zones (ESZ).&nbsp;&nbsp; These are the highest (ESZ1), high (ESZ2)\nand moderate sensitivity (ESZ3) zones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is in addition to\nthe Protected Areas managed under acts such as the Wildlife Protection Act.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It suggested that ESZ1\nand ESZ2 would be largely \u2018no-gone\u2019 zones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It proposed to divide\nthe area into about 2,200 grids, of which 75 per cent would fall under ESZ I or\nII or under already existing protected areas such as wildlife sanctuaries or\nnatural parks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Major recommendations\nof Madhav Gadgil Committee:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ban on the cultivation\nof genetically modified in the entire area<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plastic bags to be\nphased out in three years<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No new special economic\nzones or hill stations to be allowed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ban on conversion of\npublic lands to private lands, and on diversion of forest land for non-forest\npurposes in ESZ I and II<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No new mining licences\nin ESZ I and II area<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No new dams, thermal\npower plants or large-scale wind power projects in ESZ I<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No new polluting\nindustries in ESZ I and ESZ II areas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No new railway lines or\nmajor roads in ESZ I and II areas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strict regulation of\ntourism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cumulative impact\nassessment for all new projects like dams, mines, tourism, housing</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phase-out of all\nchemical pesticides within five to eight years in ESZ I and ESZ II<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Madhav Gadgil Panel recommendations can be\nsummarized in the following:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turn entire Western\nGhats region into an Ecologically Sensitive Area (ESA); it should be called\nWestern Ghats ESA.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since Western Ghats is\nspread in six states, treat Western Ghats regions of each state separately.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Final demarcation of\nthe ESZs and the final regulatory regime should be based on extensive inputs\nfrom local communities and local bodies viz. Gram Panchayats, Taluk Panchayats,\nZill Parishats, and Nagar Palikas, under the overall supervision of a Western\nGhats Ecology Authority (WGEA), State level Ecology Authorities and the\nDistrict Ecology Committees.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Western Ghats Ecology\nAuthority (WGEA) should be established as a statutory authority appointed by\nthe Ministry of Environment and Forest, GOI under Environment (Protection) Act\n1986 to focus on promoting transparency, openness and participation in every\nway for development and sustainability of these areas.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It recommended that the government should\nput--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An indefinite\nmoratorium on new environmental clearances for mining in ESZ-1 and ESZ-2</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phasing out of mining\nfrom ESZ-1 by 2015</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Continuation of\nexisting mining in ESZ-2 under strict regulation with an effective system of\nsocial audit.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In ESA-1 and ESA-2, no\nnew red and orange category industries&nbsp;\nshould be allowed.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Development plans\nshould not be cast in a rigid framework, but ought to be tailored to prevalent\nlocality and time specific conditions with full participation of local communities;\na process that has been termed adaptive co-management.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ecological sensitivity\nis not merely a scientific, but very much a human concern. In particular, a\ngreat deal of locality specific understanding of what has been happening and\nwhat is desirable, is simply not part of any scientific databases and resides\nwith local communities. Hence, set of regulations tailored to the needs of the\nlocality should be put in place if the area were to be formally declared as\nbeing ecologically sensitive</span><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gadgil report is\nagainst dams in the Western Ghats, which was a crucial blow on the ailing power\nsector. Considering the growing energy needs of India, critics argued that this\nrecommendation cannot be taken.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mining, polluting\nindustries as well as large-scale development activities, including new railway\nlines are restricted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It also objected to new\ndams, thermal power stations or massive windmill farms or new townships in\nESZ1.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The panel however gave\nimportance to the local communities and gram sabhas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were given a\nlarger say in deciding on matters relating to the ecology of these regions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It also called for--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">stricter regulation on\ntourism</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">phasing out of plastics\nand chemical fertilisers</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a ban on diversion of\nforest land into non-forest applications</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a ban on conversion of\npublic lands into private lands</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-iCYzm5ssxXA/W4pxg47v-eI/AAAAAAABd_U/mlWLs7_3NC0Dw3uw04sqLOXzRYk4tTEEwCLcBGAs/s1600/AJIT%2B8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"479\" data-original-width=\"638\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-iCYzm5ssxXA/W4pxg47v-eI/AAAAAAABd_U/mlWLs7_3NC0Dw3uw04sqLOXzRYk4tTEEwCLcBGAs/s640/AJIT%2B8.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The report was also\nunacceptable to any of the six Western Ghats States.&nbsp; These included Kerala, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu,\nGoa, Maharashtra and Gujarat as well as Pondicherry (UT).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gadgil panel faced\nstiff resistance from all political parties, particularly in Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was primarily\nbecause of the involvement of private land.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large part of the\necologically sensitive zones belonged to private citizens.&nbsp; Nearly 40% of the granite quarries in Kerala\nin 2014-15 were located in ecologically sensitive areas.&nbsp; Significantly, a quarter of them were in the\nGadgil committee-earmarked extremely sensitive ESZ1.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gadgil report\nrecommended that no new dams based on large-scale storage be permitted in\nEcologically Sensitive Zone 1 as defined by the panel. This included a\nsuggestion to not give clearance to the Athirappilly and Gundia hydel projects.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;For all settlements and built areas/ to be\ndeveloped areas, certain types of areas would be no-go areas, including\nwatercourses, water bodies, special habitats, geological formations,\nbiodiversity-rich areas, and sacred groves. Special Economic Zones should not\nbe permitted. New hill stations should not be allowed and public lands should\nnot be converted to private lands.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A building code should be evolved which\nincludes inter-alia eco-friendly building material and construction methods,\nminimizing the use of steel, cement, and sand, providing water harvesting\nmethods, non-conventional energy and waste treatment. The application or\ndetailing of the framework would be done by local authorities to suit local conditions.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Certain practices\nrecognized as the best construction/development ones such as topsoil\nconservation, trees conservation, etc. should be followed as per the guidelines\nof Green Building certifications of Eco Housing and GRIHA. Any other appropriate\ncodes are also to be encouraged.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certain activities such as filling of marshes/\nwetlands, the introduction of alien invasive species are not permitted. The\narea that may be saved is to be restricted; paving of ground areas may be done\nin such a manner that there is no change in the run-off/permeability of the\nplot overall before and after paving (if some area is paved, the recharge from\nother areas will have to be enhanced).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Local authorities should be made responsible\nfor developing regional systems for handling hazardous, toxic, biomedical\nwastes as well as recyclable materials.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Promote organic\nagricultural practices; discourage cultivation of annual crops on slopes\nexceeding 30%, where perennial crops should be promoted; introduce incentive\npayments for sequestration of carbon in soils, introduce incentive payments for\nmaintenance of select traditional cultivars, encourage participatory breeding\nprogrammes to improve the productivity of traditional cultivars; encourage\nprecision in agricultural practices.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Forest Rights Act to be\nimplemented in its true spirit by reaching out to people to facilitate their\nclaims, Community Forest Resource provisions under FRA to replace all current\nJoint Forest Management programmes.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;No new licenses to be given for mining. Where\nmining exists, it should be phased out in 5 years, by 2016. Detailed plans for\nenvironmental and social rehabilitation of mines to be closed. Illegal mining\nto be stopped immediately.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Educate the energy\nconsumer about the environmental and social impacts of energy production and\nthe need for reducing luxury demand. Encourage demand-side management; enhanced\nenergy efficiency across sectors. Launch smart campaigns as key components of\ndemand-side management, focusing on smart grids, smart buildings, smart power,\nsmart logistics and smart motors.
