, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bhavanti sampada\u1e41\ndaiv\u012bm abhij\u0101tasya bh\u0101rata<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fzHnvWC7JNk/W3lbe9kACYI/AAAAAAABdr4/6jK-1hd-SIIPsIIjU6vcUURrq1UPROw0QCLcBGAs/s1600/dDownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"250\" data-original-width=\"201\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fzHnvWC7JNk/W3lbe9kACYI/AAAAAAABdr4/6jK-1hd-SIIPsIIjU6vcUURrq1UPROw0QCLcBGAs/s400/dDownload.jpg\" width=\"321\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 16.1-3: The Supreme\nDivine Personality said: O scion of Bharat, these are the saintly virtues of\nthose endowed with a divine nature\u2014fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness\nin spiritual knowledge, charity, control of the senses, performance of\nsacrifice, <span style=\"background-color: white;\">contemplation</span> , austerity, and straightforwardness; non-violence,\ntruthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from\nfault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of covetousness,\ngentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness; vigor, forgiveness, fortitude,\ncleanliness, bearing enmity toward none, and absence of vanity.-&nbsp; Bhagawad Gita 4000 BC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ZqkdM-X4oxY/W3lb1enRwTI/AAAAAAABdsE/5FTfxGc9rWMpDLFT7a_IsLtEtQFH06CwQCLcBGAs/s1600/doDDwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"168\" data-original-width=\"300\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ZqkdM-X4oxY/W3lb1enRwTI/AAAAAAABdsE/5FTfxGc9rWMpDLFT7a_IsLtEtQFH06CwQCLcBGAs/s400/doDDwnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term svadhyaya\ncomes from the Sanskrit roots sva, meaning \"self\" or \"own,\"\nand adhyaya, meaning \"lesson,\" \"reading\" or \" the root\ndyhai, which means \" \"<span style=\"background-color: white;\">contemplate</span>.\" Both interpretations connote\na close study of the self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WiecWLCLplw/W3leX8eFxZI/AAAAAAABdsc/6D2TlbWXuzcV2wOHBLlcn3r7EcEchw4LACLcBGAs/s1600/Dimages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"192\" data-original-width=\"263\" height=\"292\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WiecWLCLplw/W3leX8eFxZI/AAAAAAABdsc/6D2TlbWXuzcV2wOHBLlcn3r7EcEchw4LACLcBGAs/s400/Dimages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">See what you discover\nwhen you delve into yourself with an open mind and heart. By thoroughly\ncontemplating yourself,&nbsp; you\u2019ll move\nbeyond the boundaries of thought and emotion and tap into the pure\nconsciousness that lies deep within.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5xTqByo0Lks/W3lfQMldgHI/AAAAAAABdso/cXyTugE1ABQBVrblwVfY-XDKWCiZQGQ9gCLcBGAs/s1600/imKKages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5xTqByo0Lks/W3lfQMldgHI/AAAAAAABdso/cXyTugE1ABQBVrblwVfY-XDKWCiZQGQ9gCLcBGAs/s400/imKKages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya refers to any\nactivity wherein we quietly study ourselves and reflect upon our actions,\nthoughts, emotions, motivations, aspirations, desires and needs in pursuit of a\ndeeper experience of our lives and our own selves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>BELOW: IN ANCIENT INDIA AMAVASYA DAY ( NEW MOON ) WAS A HOLIDAY ..&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>THIS DAY WAS USED FOR REST ,&nbsp; SILENCE,&nbsp; AUTOPHAGY BY FASTING&nbsp; AND FOR CONTEMPLATION ..</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-aPGcreEx904/W3lfysyO2ZI/AAAAAAABdsw/O2dF7zk2grsyLUTVPv8vv4JL-_g_gOK7gCLcBGAs/s1600/imwages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"275\" data-original-width=\"183\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-aPGcreEx904/W3lfysyO2ZI/AAAAAAABdsw/O2dF7zk2grsyLUTVPv8vv4JL-_g_gOK7gCLcBGAs/s400/imwages.jpg\" width=\"266\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we know we are\ndivine, then we can hear others in their hate, and remain unaffected. If we\nknow we are beyond the body and mind, we can sit in our pain without pushing it\naway <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ARE THE SOUL..&nbsp; INDIANS RESPECT THE SOUL IN OTHERS BY DOING NAMASTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WF19YHbRlD4/W3lh03BCT0I/AAAAAAABds8/CqNGzfcKC9wMJdqfl4x6atbT5C4MLDbmQCLcBGAs/s1600/Wimages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"163\" data-original-width=\"310\" height=\"210\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WF19YHbRlD4/W3lh03BCT0I/AAAAAAABds8/CqNGzfcKC9wMJdqfl4x6atbT5C4MLDbmQCLcBGAs/s400/Wimages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0927\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f\u093e\u0926\u093f\u0937\u094d\u091f\u0926\u0947\u0935\u0924\u093e\u0938\u0902\u092a\u094d\u0930\u092f\u094b\u0917\u0903\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contemplate to discover\nthe divine.\u2014\u2009Patanjali\u2019s Yogasutra, II.44&nbsp;\n( 5000 BC )</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2.44\u2014 svadhyayad\nishtadevatasanprayogah</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contemplation leads\ntowards the realisation of God or communion with one's desired deity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The necessity to\nvisualize God as an object, or an ishta devata, arises on account of the\ndifficulty of the mind in transcending space and time. In Hinduism we are given\na free choice on what we want to focus our mind on . We are not armtwisted to\nfocus our mind on a man bleeding to death on a cross.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shallow minded people who\ndo not understand the essence of meditation , will never understand why Hindus\nworship idols, though our god is brahmAn ( the morphogenetic consciousness\nfield ) which cannot be picked up by the 5 senses .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kula Devata is the\nGod/Goddess worshipped by the family, by tradition. This Kula Devata is the God\nto whom the family would do prayer before any auspicious occasion is done at\nhome: like marriage, upanayan sanskar etc.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kula Devata cannot be substituted by Ishta Devata as Ishta Devata can be\nspecific to each person, even in a family.&nbsp;\nIshta Devata is the personal Deity who will guide the soul to its real\nhome- Moksha at the seventh astral layer f the field of BrahmAn .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The immoral white invader used this Ishta\ndevata concept to drive wedges. They made devotees of Vishnu and Shiva fight\nand abuse each other using the FAKE and backdated mutts. Hindus must know that the\nTRINITY works in tandem and in harmony.&nbsp;\n.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya is&nbsp; also practicing our individual sadhana\n(spiritual pursuit) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyayam is the\nexercise of the self, by the self, and for the self .Witnessing yourself and\nstudying one\u2019s own personality is&nbsp; swadhyaya.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This implies the ability to read one\u2019s life\nlike a book, to be aware of each and every page.&nbsp;&nbsp; In other words, it is the analysis of our\nown personality, being aware of our individual qualities, strengths and\nweaknesses, in order to know what and who we are.&nbsp; Introspection and self analysis is useful\nonly if translated into action.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A yogi\nwill not cheat himself during self analysis.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nHe can fail himself.&nbsp; Self\nreflection for a yogi is a humbling process.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Always use adversity to introspect. These are god given opportunities to\ndrive real change. The heart and mind of a person can be understood by knowing\nwhat he aspires to be-&nbsp; not what he is or\nwhat he was.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is only one thing in\nthis cosmos which you can be cock sure is bringing change to yourself with self\ndiscipline. The other is death.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything which irritates us about others can\nlead to an understanding of ourselves. Your current comfort zone and safe\nboundaries were once unknown frontiers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can take off your clothes and show\nyourself to a whore. This is not the real opening up. Rather opening up is\nabout revealing your soul&nbsp; ( dreams,\nthoughts, fears&nbsp; etc )\u2014 this is the true\nmeaning of being naked. Swadhyaya is a process of witnessing our own\nconsciousness.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhyaya implies continually\nwatching our actions and reactions in different situations, circumstances and\nevents with more awareness. We should try to know the reasons for our happiness\nand sorrow, anger, greed and attachment. As a result, we will gradually find\nout how our mind works and will become more aware of the things that disturb\nour mind.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With an understanding of our\nweaknesses in particular, we can chart out a multi-faceted program to weed them\nout, and thus prepare the ground for our gradual upliftment. Thus this type of\nself-analysis is of great value in our life.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhaya was done by Hindus during\nAmavasya ( New moon ) days when he fasted and observed a vrat of silence..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/amavasya-poornima-ekadashi-fasting.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/amavasya-poornima-ekadashi-fasting.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhyaya also\nmeans closing the eyes and observing one\u2019s own self, as is done in antar mouna\npractice.&nbsp;&nbsp; Self-analysis is a great tool\nof jnana yoga.&nbsp; If practised with faith,\nsincerity and regularity, it will lead to mental peace, emotional harmony and\nbring the aspirant closer to the inner nature..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhyaya is the practice of self-study and self-analysis.&nbsp; ..&nbsp;\nSvadhyaya inspires and elevates the mind to high spiritual altitude. It\nclears doubts. It weeds out unholy ideas. It cuts new spiritual grooves for the\nmind to move on.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It reduces wandering of the&nbsp;\nmind or Vikshepa. It helps concentration.&nbsp; It serves pasture for the mind to graze\nupon.&nbsp; Svadhyaya clears inner doubts.\nIt&nbsp; strengthens the flickering faith.. It\nfills the mind with Sattva&nbsp; or purity; it\ninspires and elevates the mind. It helps concentration and meditation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It cuts\nnew Sattvic grooves and makes the mind run in these new grooves. to have your\nafflicted body soothed, to have your bruised soul healed, and to save yourself\nfrom all kinds of ills of life which are due to ignorance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mind you all this\nwisdom was penned down in Sanskrit 7000 years ago when the rest of the planet\nwas doing <b style=\"background-color: white;\">GRUNT GRUNT</b> for language .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0924\u094d\u092f\u0902\u0935\u0926</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u0902\u091a\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0927\u094d\u092f\u093e\u092f\u093e\u0928\u094d\u092e\u093e\u092a\u094d\u0930\u092e\u0926\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Speak the Satya, follow\nthe Dharma, from Svadhyaya never cease.--\u2014\u2009<b>Taittiriya Upanishad, 1.11.1-2&nbsp; 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu Smriti's verse\n22.92, states that \"human body is cleansed by water, the mind is cleansed\nby truth, the soul by contemplation , while understanding is cleansed by\nknowledge\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasistha Dharmasastra\nverses 27.1 through 27.7 states that Svadhyaya helps an individual understand\nand overcome his past <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya is a means of\ngetting past one\u2019s past mistakes and any guilt<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE DON\u2019T NEED TO GO TO\nCHURCH AND CONFESS TOA STRANGER PRIEST<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taittiriya Upanishad\u2019s\nhymn 1.9.1 emphasizes the central importance of Svadhyaya in one\u2019s pursuit of\nReality (\u1e5ata), Truth (Satya), Self-restraint (Damah), Perseverance (Tapas),\nTranquility and Inner Peace (Samas) and Relationships with others<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taittiriya Aranyaka\n2.15: \"sv\u0101dhyayo-adhyetavyah\" (\"sv\u0101dhy\u0101ya must be\npracticed\").<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason why people\nremain mired in negativity is because of the beliefs they have inherited over\ntime. Beliefs are subconscious .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We can use our\nconscious mind to observe ,to introspect and dip into the subconscious where\nour beliefs are embedded , in order to eliminate it.&nbsp; You can meditate, to rewrite these negative\nprogrammes that cause you misery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indians use meditation\nto purify the mind and gain insight.&nbsp;\nThere is self observation and introspection ( which animals cannot do )\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The difference between\nprayer and meditation is that the former is a petition to God, and the other is\na detached observation of one's own mind, and its processes, after squelching\nthe 5 senses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During meditation\nthinking is separated from perceiving, so that the individual can stand apart\nfrom the emotional self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The purpose of\nmeditation in modern times is to destress, to stop the destructive mind\nchatter, for some time in a day--&nbsp; to\nSTILL THE MIND.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN YOU STILL YOUR\nMIND,&nbsp; NO CHEMICALS ARE PRODUCED.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brain must not be\nallowed to pump in destructive F&amp;F ( fight &amp; flight ) chemicals into\nyour body, which will shorten your life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having the advantage\nthat Svadhyaya can be practised at any time in any place, it is usually\npractised in a comfortable position with eyes closed, with complete relaxation\nof all muscle groups in the Alpha mind mode..&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you get up in the\nmorning after sleep, continue lying down in the half asleep mode for some more\ntime.. In this state you mind is in Alpha mode.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/06/alpha-state-and-earths-heartbeat-of-783.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/06/alpha-state-and-earths-heartbeat-of-783.html</a></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In the modern world, meditation is used as a\ntechnique for relaxation and stress reduction. The spiritual aims are peace of\nmind, wisdom, and, ultimately, a state of enlightenment or self-realization.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya is one of the\nthree key elements in the practice of yoga as defined in the Yoga Sutras of\nPatanjali,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya is, in a\nsense, for one\u2019s spirit and mind a process equivalent to watching one\u2019s body in\na non-distorting mirror . It is self-study, contemplation of one\u2019s own motives\nand behaviors, but also of one\u2019s circumstances and the environment one is in,\nassessing where one is in one\u2019s life, what is one\u2019s life direction, if and how\ndesirable changes may lead to a more fulfilling Self.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Purusha (the cosmic\nperson), and the Purusha Sukta (the hymn devoted to the cosmic person), is one\nof the foremost sacred texts in the svadhyaya tradition. The first three\nverses, which follow, may be used for daily contemplation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om. With countless\nheads, countless eyes, countless feet,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moving, yet the ground\nof all,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Cosmic Person is\nbeyond the reach of the senses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He is all this, all\nthat has been, and all that is to be.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He is the Lord of\nimmortality, who expands Himself as food.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such is His glory, and\nyet the Cosmic Person is more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One part of Him is\ncreation,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And three parts swell\nbeyond as His boundless light.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is in mantra\nmeditation that svadhyaya\u2014silent, inner recitation\u2014bears its fullest fruit.\nRepeating a mantra anchors the mind to one thought\u2014a sound pregnant with the\npresence of the Self. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a mantra permeates\nthe mind, it draws awareness in while the outward-going aspects of the mind\nbecome silent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By \u2018studying\u2019 our\n\u2018self\u2019, we become more aware of the things we do that harm us, and also those\nwhich serve us and bring us closer to that process of \u2018yoking\u2019 or \u2018uniting\u2019\nwith the true Self.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a key to\nrecognising our habits, and discerning between the ones which come largely from\nan ego-based place, and which ones are the result of listening to our true\nSelf.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The practice of taking\na proverbial step back and observing and questioning our actions can eventually\nallow us to disentangle ourselves from those aspects of our lives that are\nharmful towards our wellbeing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Observe yourself as\nthough you were watching someone else; observe the way you speak to friends and\nfamily, the way you react when plans change, the way you hold yourself when\nwalking or sitting, or even just the way in which you get dressed each morning\u2026\nit all tells the story of who and how we are in this moment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The practice of\nsvadhyaya requires satya (honesty) in order to view ourselves from an honest\nstandpoint</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cYoga is the journey of\nthe self, through the self, to the Self\u201d - <b>The Bhagavad Gita</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we use the yoga\npractice of svadhyaya\u2014self-reflection\u2014effectively, our actions become much more\nthan a way to achieve something external; they become a mirror in which we can\nlearn to see ourselves more deeply.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we are willing to\nlook at behaviors, motivations, and strategies we habitually use to maintain\nour own self-image, we can use svadhyaya to pierce through the veil that this\nself-image creates and into the nature of our own essential being.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ritual of\nconfession in the Roman Catholic faith\u2014can act as svadhyaya says some Christian\nconverts -- MY LEFT BALL<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To take a similar example,\nrepentance and seeking forgiveness are integral parts of the process of\npurification and illumination in both the Jewish and Islamic faiths. In\nSanatana Dharma we don\u2019t repent , only we can save ourselves,&nbsp; not some messiah or some single holybook. Sanatana\nDharma asks you to wake up by self contemplation ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a bullshit form of\nsvadhyaya, the Tibetan Buddhist contemplates the \"great thoughts that turn\nthe mind to ultimate dharma,\" thus turning the mind away from the worldly\ntoward the spiritual life .&nbsp; Sorry , in\nSanatana Dharma spiritual life is allowed only after your complete the grihasta\nstage of family life and procreation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya helps us\nunderstand ourselves, and, through that understanding,&nbsp; we can change our attitudes and behavior.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya represents an\nongoing process through which we can assess where we are at a given moment. It\nis like attuning our inner navigator and finding meaningful answers to\nquestions: Where am I now, and where am I going? What is my direction, and what\nare my aspirations? What are my responsibilities? What are my priorities?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AT SEA I CONTEMPLATE TO\nPRIORITISE MY JOBS AT HAND<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This can prevent BURN\nOUT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/12/burned-out-versus-stressed-out-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/12/burned-out-versus-stressed-out-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We often find ourselves\nengaged in ACTIVITY TRAPS on cruise control, acting habitually and being so\nswept up in the momentum of our daily lives that we don't take the time to\ncheck where we are or where we are headed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2009/07/real-work-and-activity-traps-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2009/07/real-work-and-activity-traps-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SELF OBSERVATION CAN\nSHED EGO<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we practice\nSvadhyaya \u2014noticing what we are thinking, feeling, doing, and imagining\u2014 it\nallows us to become self-aware. When we are aware of what we are doing, we\nrealize that we have choices and choices are what make us powerful.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The very act of\nnoticing how we are feeling can allow us to release or let go of a stuck or\nstagnant feeling or a self-sabotaging habit.. When you stop to observe your\nanger, you realize that the part of you doing the observing is not the same\npart that is angry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/06/anger-management-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/06/anger-management-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/06/anger-management-part-2-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/06/anger-management-part-2-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\u2019s nothing like\nspending alone time in nature to really get to know who you are. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SANATANA DHARMA GAVE US\nENOUGH TIME TO CONTEMPLATE IN SOLITUDE DURING THE VANAPRASTA AND SANYAS STAGES\nOF LIFE..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT IS ABOUT SELF\nIMPOSED SOLITUDE.&nbsp; THE GREATEST\nCREATIVITY IN ANCIENT INDIA CAME FROM SOLITUDE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PART TWO BRAHMANAS AND\nPART 3 ARANYAKAS OF THE VEDAS ( TECHNICAL TEXTS STOLEN BY THE WHITE INVADER )\nCAME DURING VANAPRASTA / SANYAS STAGE OF LIFE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a great\ndifference between LONELINESS and SOLITUDE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loneliness is the\npoverty of self, the pain of being alone, unwanted \u2014it breaks human spirit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Solitude is the\nrichness of self, the glory of being alone. In solitude mind grains strength.&nbsp; In solitude you face yourself\u2014it is delicious\nin years of human maturity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why Sanatana\nDharma insisted in Vanaprasta and Sanyasa ashramas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In solitude you have\ngod as your friend. The best thoughts come while in self imposed solitude<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Hindu system\nfour stages of life have been prescribed: brahmacharya (celibacy), grihastha\n(family life), vanaprastha (literally, living in a forest), sanyasa (total\nrenunciation).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the first stage,\nbrahmacharya, a person leads the life of a student as a celibate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After finishing the\nstudies, he enters the married life of a grihastha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having fulfilled the\nobligations to children and the society, both husband and wife follow spiritual\npursuits during Vanaprasta --they move closer to nature<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In sanyasa, a person\ncompletely renounces all worldly belongings and lives in solitude<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma&nbsp; is a just way of managing life.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhagavad Gita is all\nabout BEING IN THE MOMENT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN SANATANA DHARMA\nPRAYER IS A FORM OF INTENTION WHILE BEING IN A FRAME OF GRATITUDE TO THE\nSUPREME FORCE.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRAYER IS NOT BEGGING\nFOR MERCY LIKE IN OTHER SINGLE MESSIAH / SINGLE HOLYBOOK RELIGIONS..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN A HINDU PRAYS HE\nDOES NOT NEED TO LISTEN TO SOMEONE HOLLERING BRAINWASH STUFF ON\nLOUDSPEAKER&nbsp; -- THAT ONLY MY GOD IS EKDUM\nAWWAL \u2014 NO 1 , BAKI RELIGIONS KA GODS SUB CHOOTIYA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shishya of a\nGurukul broke free of ordinary human conditioning and attained a state called\nawakening&nbsp; by Nididhyasana .&nbsp; He broke through into universal consciousness\nitself, and beyond that even, into the pure awareness of the absolute.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nidhidhyasana refers to\nthe contemplative state which is induced by the verse a student has listened to\nand understood. He will chew the cud over this by meditation and now can\ninterpolate and extrapolate to glimpse the magic of that verse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 63.25pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By\nNididhyasana or deep contemplation the information processed by Shranana and\nManana becomes&nbsp; part of the individual (\ncellular memory ).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 63.25pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 63.25pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shravana meant listening and understanding. Manana is\nreflection on the content imbibed by Shravana .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 63.25pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 63.25pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manana is contemplation till everything becomes crystal clear and there\nare no more doubts . By this process the information obtained by Shravana\npercolates into the bed rock of the mind<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; tab-stops: 63.25pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nididhyasana is the\npractice of atma-vichara, contemplation, self-enquiry, self-investigation,\nself-scrutiny or self-attentiveness.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nIt leads to Nirvikalpa Samadhi from where there is no return into lower\nstates of consciousness. Samadhi is a spiritual state of consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nididhyasana\nis the last frontier the mind has to cross. It is the ultimate sadhana which\none has to keep doing till the Truth is realised.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nididhyasana is the\nfinal step of the spiritual journey but the most difficult one.&nbsp;&nbsp; It is only with the grace of God and\nattunements received from of the Guru that one can reach and cross over this\nstage. Nididhyasana , leads to the realization of Truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nididhyasana is a\nsubjective meditation (atma vicara), in which the yogi withdraws his ego to its\noriginal source, instead of allowing it to chase the surrounding world.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As withdrawal of ego is\ncomplicated, the aspirant by observance of continence, and with the help of an\nadept guru, motivates and prepares his intellect through upasana initially, and\nrises to nididhyasana level of contemplation.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thoughts and emotions\nhave an electromagnetic frequency vibration that is perceived by every cell in\nthe body through the instant communication system of scalar waves.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The end product of a\nGurukul was&nbsp; an all round , well balanced\npersonality , an expert in life management.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His greatest wealth\nwas&nbsp; contentment with little . It\nconsists in simple wants. The blatant display of status symbols&nbsp; is the result of low self esteem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The self confident\nperson can afford to project a modest image.&nbsp;\nOnly people with inferiority complex wants to impress others. He will\nnever fall into the same hole twice<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For a Gurukul product\nno order is higher than his own intelligence and conscience . &nbsp;He is a success in life as all he really wants\nis only what he really needs. The gurukul product will engage any problem\nwithout getting overwhelmed.&nbsp; He will\nfind a good match between the demands of the situation and his own innate\nability.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient Maharishis\n( products of Nididhyasana ) were Epistemologists whose theories deal with\npuzzles about the source, nature, foundation, scope, validity and limits of\nhuman knowledge.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedas show how ancient rishis experienced the divine reality\nand how they responded with exuberant joy, confidence and a feeling of\nintimacy.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DrwekF6EOVE/W3pOJIor2pI/AAAAAAABdtU/AcuSxZWHCd8Ndpr_b136LjLEyLlRs9UWgCLcBGAs/s1600/imzages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"175\" data-original-width=\"289\" height=\"387\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DrwekF6EOVE/W3pOJIor2pI/AAAAAAABdtU/AcuSxZWHCd8Ndpr_b136LjLEyLlRs9UWgCLcBGAs/s640/imzages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/02/we-hindu-indians-are-proudest-people-on.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/02/we-hindu-indians-are-proudest-people-on.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This practice of\ncontemplation can give us more insight into our relationships, both with\nourselves and others. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Silencing the body is\neasy, but silencing the mind is difficult in this modern age. Silencing is\nabout grace, harmony and tranquility. Exhaustion is NOT tranquility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the modern age\npeople get stressed, and they need to still the mind--the chattering monkey,\nwhich remains entangled in the past and the imagined future, but never in the\npresent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal of self-study\nis to be curious about what we take for granted and recognize and release\ntendencies that aren\u2019t useful. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person stops thinking\neither when he is dead or when he has realised. When your ego powered mind is\nchattering like a monkey or the angry sea, you miss the truth. Truth can be\ncommunicated only in silence. For this deep silence you need to have harmony\nbetween the mind, body and soul. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aim of every form\nof meditation is to still the mind, or you cant purify it and get rid of deep\nrooted negativities , which affect your health and even give you severe\nmigraines. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contemplation is a\nsurgical operation of your subconscious mind to remove and discard negativity /\nego and improve tolerance, grace and kindness.&nbsp;\nThe art of observing is to help you feel separate from all that you are\nclinging to. Depression is a weird feeling of loss .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svadhyaya teaches you\nto look inwards, with awareness , within yourself and loosen the stranglehold\nof habits and vices. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He just witnesses , he\ndoes not react. His mind does not control him, rather he controls his mind. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Restrict your attention\nto what is occurring in the immediate PRESENT MOMENT . &nbsp;&nbsp;Don't think about the past or future\u2014 don't\nthink about anything at all. Let go of worries, concerns, and memories. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Svadhaya the aim is\nnot to think, but only to know. The motto is: \"Focus and forget it,\"\nor \"know and let go.\"&nbsp;&nbsp; Healing\nis NOT a physical process, rather it is mental. Mind can wipe mistakes off the\nDNA blueprint and destroy any disease that has disturbed the design. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DNA's ability to repair\nitself is affected adversely when a person is in depression. Meditation\nexperiences silence, and is devoid of drives, wishes, fears , thoughts and\nemotions. Afterwards when the mind returns to its usual level of consciousness,\nit has acquired some freedom to move..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grace and peace are the\nhallmarks of a healthy non-delusional mind in a healthy body.. The happiness is\nstable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ROTHSCHILDs AGENT JEW\n</span><span style=\"color: red;\">WILHELM WUNDT </span><span style=\"color: blue;\">LIFTED HIS ENTIRE WORK ON INTROSPECTION FROM SVADHYAYA\nINFORMATION PROVIDED IN OUR PART 3 ARANYAKAS OF VEDAS , WHICH WERE STOLEN AND\nTAKEN TO THE UNIVERSITY OF LEIPZIG GERMANY. <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wilhelm Wundt opened\nthe Institute for Experimental Psychology at the University of Leipzig in\nGermany in 1879.&nbsp; This was the first\nlaboratory dedicated to psychology, and its opening is KICK STARTED modern\npsychology..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wilhelm Wundt\nobfuscated by putting some stupid OBJECTIVE experiments based on five human\nsenses \u2013 just to show that he is the father of his theory .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example,\nparticipants would be exposed to a standard stimulus (e.g. a light or the sound\nof a metronome) and asked to report their sensations. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trained assistants would be given a stimulus\nsuch as a ticking metronome and would reflect on the experience. They would\nreport what the stimulus made them think and feel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The stupid fellow called\nthis voluntarism, the process of organizing the mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wundt baby with\ninferior intellect believed in reductionism-- he believed consciousness could\nbe broken down (or reduced) to its basic elements without sacrificing any of\nthe properties of the whole. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AIYOOO TOBA TOAAHBAAAH <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS CHOOT WILHEM WUNDT\nDOES NOT KNOW THAT INTROSPECTION IS </span><span style=\"color: red;\">SUBJECTIVE</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"> AND CANNOT BE HARNESSED OR\nINCISED BY HIS PISS FART </span><span style=\"color: red;\">OBJECTIVE </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">EXPERIMENTS.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The results of\nintrospection are subjective and cannot be verified because only observable\nbehavior can be objectively measured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SO I SHALL DISCARD\nTHIS CUNT INTO THE VADAKAYIL GARBAGE BIN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CAPTAIN AJIT VADAKAYIL\nCAN FIT THE INTELLECT OF A THOUSAND WILHELM WUNDTs UNDER THE FORESKIN OF HIS UNCIRCUMCISED PRICK AND HAVE 99% SPACE MORE.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">HE MUST KNOW THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN <span style=\"color: red;\">MUNDI SEH GAAND TAK </span>PROCESSING AND WHAT IS <span style=\"color: blue;\">CHOOTHAD OOPAR</span> PROCESSING ..</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/08/objective-arguments-but-subjective.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/08/objective-arguments-but-subjective.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/discretion-subjective-objective-value.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/discretion-subjective-objective-value.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
